Critical Issues Found

Issue #1: Help Center Page Does Not Exist

Severity: üî¥ HIGH - Critical

Issue Type: Missing Page / Broken Navigation

Description: The Help Center link in the vendor dashboard sidebar points to /vendor/help, but this route returns a 404 error indicating the page has not been implemented.

Steps to Reproduce: 1. Login as vendor with credentials from test data 2. Navigate to vendor dashboard (/vendor/my-store) 3. Click on ‚ÄúHelp Center‚Äù link in the sidebar under ‚ÄúMore‚Äù section 4. Observe 404 error page

Expected Behavior: - Help Center page should load with vendor support resources - Should display FAQ, documentation, or contact support options - Should be accessible to logged-in vendors

Actual Behavior: - 404 error page displayed - Message: ‚ÄúThis page could not be found.‚Äù - No help or support content available

Technical Details:

URL: https://alimas-staging-production.up.railway.app/vendor/help
HTTP Status: 404 Not Found
Console Error: Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 ()
Error Path: /vendor/help?_rsc=6yfje

Impact: - Vendors cannot access help or support resources - Poor user experience for vendors needing assistance - Missing critical support functionality - Violates user expectations for a help/support section

Screenshots: - help_center_404_error.png - Shows the 404 error page - vendor_dashboard.png - Shows Help Center link in sidebar

Recommendations

Priority 1 - Critical (Immediate Action Required)

  1. Implement Help Center Page
    • Create /vendor/help route and page component
    • Include vendor support documentation
    • Add FAQ section for common vendor questions
    • Provide contact support options
  2. Remove or Disable Non-Functional Link
    • If Help Center cannot be implemented immediately, temporarily disable or hide the link
    • Add ‚ÄúComing Soon‚Äù badge if feature is under development

Priority 2 - High (Should Address Soon)

  1. Add Error Handling
    • Implement proper error handling for missing routes
    • Create custom 404 page with navigation back to dashboard
    • Log 404 errors for monitoring
  2. Fix Multiple GoTrueClient Warning
    • Review authentication implementation
    • Ensure only one instance of GoTrueClient is created
    • May cause authentication issues if not addressed

Priority 3 - Medium (Performance Optimization)

  1. Optimize CSS Preloading
    • Review and fix unused CSS preload resources
    • Improve page load performance

Conclusion

The ALIMAS Vendor Help Center feature requires immediate attention as it is completely non-functional. While the vendor dashboard and login functionality work as expected, the missing Help Center page represents a critical gap in vendor support infrastructure.

Action Required: - Implement Help Center page at /vendor/help - Or remove/hide the Help Center link until implementation is complete

Estimated Impact: - User Experience: High negative impact - Functionality: Critical missing feature - Business Impact: Vendors unable to access support resources
